mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Pope, William, b. 1787
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Resolutions in last court relative to encouragement of home manufacturers; citizens of Powhatan to appear in complete suit of homespun on certain day; asks president to do the same; Tories disliked Jefferson's plain dress and his wearing homespun now would drive them out of country in disgust but to American people it would be elegant and patriotic.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826--Correspondence
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, 1808 May 30, Montpelier, [Virginia] to [Thomas Jefferson], n.p.
